author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1696069945}
review:
RollerForce is a low poly VR exclusive rail shooter where the rails are quite literally the rails of a roller coaster.  Yeah, that isn't what the old, dead, obsolete rail shooter genre needed to kick it back into life.   So basically you put your VR headset on and look at things and shoot them while you're on a roller coaster.  I have no idea why anyone thought that would be a good idea, let alone good enough to waste $100 self publishing it as a game on Steam, but here we are.

The game features lazy minimalist/untextured low-polygon "retro" assets and visuals, making this look like a barely functional 3D game from the early 1990s.  The lack of textures is a method that lazy devs often use to disguise their lack of talent/interest in doing the graphics properly and trying to disguise it under the name of "art", or "We made it look bad on purpose", which really isn't something gamers should have to put up with.  It's unclear why the developers weren't willing to arrange high quality, high polygon count contemporary assets and high resolution textures for the game.  It looks bad as a result of their decisions, and that's just another reason to avoid it.

This seems to have been made a VR exclusive to prevent any comparison with non-VR 3D games, a comparison that this game would fail very badly at.  Developers must learn that while VR is great, if the only thing that makes the game great is the VR, then the game isn't great at all.

The poor quality of this game is reflected by how many people spent time with it.  At the time of this review, SteamDB shows the all-time peak player number was only 9 players.  This is a remarkably low number, and now, the only player activity occurs once or twice a month, presumably someone loading it up to see what it is then quickly uninstalling it.  Considering there's over 120 million gamers on Steam and well over 50,000 games for gamers to choose from (over 9,000 completely free titles), the overwhelming lack of interest in this low quality game is to be expected.

RollerForce has the laughable, eye-watering price of around $5 USD, it's not worth it given the defects and shortcomings with the product, especially considering the sheer number of completely free, much higher quality games on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020476927', 'num_games_owned': 2206, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1568161919}
review:
Cheap game for cheap thrills. 

It's not unplayable, but it gets old quickly.
It's a 360 degree roller coaster (at roller coaster speeds) where you attack and defend from all sides as you are riding this thing for 3 loops.

Loop 1: Here's the track, here's some enemies coming to attack, boom boom, shoot and survive.
Loop 2: Ok, you know the track, here's some more enemies and some hiding around certain geographic elements now.
Loop 3: I hope you're good at aiming, because they are! MORE ENEMIES FROM ALL SIDES!
(again, this is all while going ROLLER COASTER SPEEDS)

There are health pickups along the way, but imagine shooting a cork gun from a roller coaster at a still from about 10-30 meters. You can also go into slow-mo:
- Slow Mo is required to survive, to play, to really progress in anyway. Perhaps the intention is to get so good that you can blind fire all the levels at max speed the whole time.

Git gud nub, cause if you don't slomo and mow them down, you will die on loop 3 and it's time to start from the top!

In slomo, it is an interesting experience, but again, it gets old rather fast. Not quite a rail shooter like Area 51 or Time Crisis, and it's not a roller coaster simulator either. 

I got it for around 25 cents in a bundle via internet search: Game bundles, and that's an acceptable price for this game, but it doesn't feel worth it at 5 dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066590240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2800, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1551590779}
review:
[h1]Experienced on the Oculus Rift with Touch Controllers[/h1]

I'm honestly surprised by the Mostly Positive review status for this game. I got this game in a VR bundle and basically got it for less than .50 cents USD. I would be hard pressed to recommend this game at even that price. This game is definitely not worth $5 USD.

Several reviews mention the aim being broken. I didn't notice that issue. Some reviews mention motion sickness or nausea ... wow, maybe don't review VR games? This is an easy, comfortable VR roller coaster ride with shooting. The problem is that it's boring as hell.

The gameplay gets repetitive after 1/3 laps for a track is completed. There are really only 2 tracks. But there's 4 difficulties for each of those two tracks with a freeplay mode for each thrown in. However, those extra modes hardly matter. After playing 1 lap of each track, you'll feel like you have already played the game too long. There's no reason to do additional laps for more of the same, dull, uninspired gameplay.

Shooting on a roller coaster should feel like a wild, thrill ride ... not in this game. The biggest thrill is to your retinas as you get all kind of bright-colored explosions in front of your face / eyes. You may want to see an Optometrist after playing this game. The environments are bland and the shooting is just repetitive. Let me say it again, the whole game is repetitive.

But you don't need to take my word for it. I made a video review, showing off the gameplay. Watch it here: 

https://youtu.be/U42GxPxWZdg

[b]Rate 4/10. It's just dull and it's also unpleasant on the eyes.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197981997702', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1523892852}
review:
OK, I had to come post my first impressions... FANTASTIC FUN.... if you like just comfort shooting games and roller coasters don't make you feel weird; this is a Must Have Game.

Shooting has been corrected, way back, I'm not sure the game will get further developed, but its very fun and enjoyable.  Also, a great introduction for friends that want to shoot and experience VR.

Touch Controllers work perfectly.

Hat's off to the developers creating a simple shooter with the roller coaster making simple shooting more difficult.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303423028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1486450330}
review:
游戏好不好玩？画面是否够看？可以来看看我的真实游戏体验
http://v.youku.com/v_show/id_XMTc3MzExNDY5Ng==.html?spm=a2hzp.8253869.0.0&from=y1.7-2
这是一款过山车+射击的非常刺激的VR游戏。我觉得新人一定要坐着玩……否则真的会倒地不起……
特点：一个充满科技感的优选绚丽的几何画面，你需要在坐过山车的同时，操作手柄去攻击沿途的障碍物，虽然过山车的速度不算很快，但是不断高高低低的起伏，以及突然出现的一些非常近的圆圈会需要人不断躲闪，想感受一下浮空的、垂直的过山车的朋友，一定要来试试。
遗憾：太晕了……感觉玩个游戏要怀孕了。毕竟VR这种沉浸感是很强的，恐高的人也要慎入。

author: {'steamid': '76561197969913402', 'num_games_owned': 3553, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1530911833}
review:
This game has such a neat concept.  You're basically combining a "rail shooter" with literal rails (in the form of a roller coaster track).  Unfortunately the execution of the concept isn't as good.

It boils down to this: the "coaster" is moving so fast and yet the game is lagged behind so it never seems like you're shooting where you're aiming. The game hints that you'll need to aim ahead, but to me it seems like you need to aim EARLY as well as ahead.  Maybe if I turn the graphics down somehow it'll work better.  Nothing in the game looks so intense that it would stress out the GTX 1080 SC I have though.  It's also not like the framerate is bad in game.  It's just that my shots seem lagged by about 100-120ms or so.

The weirdness of this effect is that I can fire a shot, and because I'm moving forward and the track is going downward, I'll see the shot fly from slightly behind me and above me even though my gun is by my waist.  I tried repositioning the controllers in several ways to see if it was some weirdness from the way it was being tracked but it didn't seem to matter.  Shots to the side didn't seem to be lagged as bad.  Only shooting directly in front.

Things I liked:
[list]
  [*] Rollercoasters and guns, sounds like a good time.
  [*] The main menu graphics look nice
  [*] There's an exit option that actually exits the game instead of having to hit the steam button and exit from there like a bunch of other games.
  [*] The scenery changes from day to night as you go through the various laps.
  [*] For the most part, the coasters are exciting enough to feel like a ride, and mild enough that you aren't horking up your intestines.
[/list]

Things I didn't like:
[list]
  [*] The apparent lag in the shots.  Your shots are all projectiles instead of beams or hitscan so aiming them is annoying.
  [*] The enemy is rather uninspired.  most of them are just jagged blobs of whatever.  Only one or two enemies struck me as cool.
  [*] Half the time you can't even tell what the hell hit you. 
  [*] Because of the lag, hitting the "health" pickups is made extra difficult though it seemed worse on later levels than the first level (maybe because there are fewer health pickups)
  [*] After you finish your 3rd lap and "win" it makes you take a victory lap around the track and really, 3 laps is plenty, thank you.  
  [*] The music isn't very memorable.  This is another game where immediately after quitting the game I can't even remember what the songs sounded like. 
[/list]

I love the concept of the game, I just don't like the execution.  Also the game store page says "10 tracks" but 2 of those tracks are marked "Free ride" so really there's only 8 levels.

I feel like this game needs a bit more polish on the enemies and some of the game mechanics to be more fun. Most people would probably say "Eh, it's only $5, so who cares?" but I'm not likely to get 5 hours of gameplay out of this (because it's not that much fun).  I'm not going to refund it, but I wouldn't recommend it either.  OR if you're going to buy it, at least you know what you're in for.
developer_response: Thank you for the review. Have you tried the update? We altered the firing to hopefully feel more responsive and accurate.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972025376', 'num_games_owned': 1072, 'num_reviews': 265, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1475711719}
review: This game is sensory overload, and I like that sort of thing. There's so much going on that you can barely keep track. The shooting mechanics need work because you don't really feel like you're aiming reliably. Rather, it feels like you're spamming bullets in the hopes that it will hit something. It needs better accuracy. It's worth the current 4.99 price though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110130924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1563836794}
review: The game is worth 5 dollars just to ride around the tracks which look sharp. However its more of an experience than a game right now. I say this because the aiming needs to be fixed. You can just flail the controllers around and blindly squeeze the triggers and hit as much as if you were aiming. Feels pointless. Hard to tell what are targets, would be nice if there were points or something to designate hitting a target. So fun experience riding the tracks, smooth and well worth 5 bucks. The shooting reallly needs a lot of work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039512061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1475292985}
review:
Finally we have a decent roller coaster game for the Vive!
I don't know why it took so long, roller coaster shooters were everywhere on the Cardboard market...
The visuals are great, didn't get too motion sick until I'd gone all the way through the first track, and that's for someone experienced with the Vive.
I highly suggest you change the firing mechanic from a bullet-based shot to a constant laser beam. I have no interest in leading targets. There should also be a peaceful mode if I just want to go for a ride. Also I think the enemy attacks are too chaotic, I'd like to have an easier time grasping their attack visuals. Maybe if there were just enemies in the form of traps, like lasers crossing the track you have to disable the emitters for, the game would be pretty perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985887185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1475666207}
review: Fun, polished and challenging (at least the 4 most difficult levels). Well worth the asking price. The guns feels a bit weird, they are not shooting but aiming rockets, witch adds to the challange. I was bummed out at first there doesn't seem to be any scoring system to compete for highscores, but the later levels is difficult enough that it still will last me a while. No motion sickness after about 40 min of play. I don't have an iron stomach, but seldom get motion sickness anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977172115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1482560984}
review:
*Edit-  They listened to the criticism about the shooting and the latest update is a big improvement in my book.  The game feels great now!  So I'll leave my original review for context,  but know that I can wholeheartedly recommend this game even more than before.  

*Original review- This is a good game,  but it could be a great one if the problem of the shots coming from so far behind you is fixed.  It really kills a lot of the fun to be shooting at everything and bullets are flying from 20' behind you.  It makes it feel like you can't really aim at anything,  almost like you're pointing at stuff that someone else is shooting at.  That said,  it's still a thumbs up for being an excellent rollercoaster VR with a high level of polish and content for the price. 

It didn't make me sick and I giggled like a schoolgirl on a rollercoaster with guns.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988815448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1473917674}
review:
Wow this game is pretty fantastic. Def one of the better VR games I've tried.

Your player moves pretty fast along a rail as you shoot enemies out of the sky, like a roller coaster. Intense! Really like the music. The bullets lag behind the player a bit so sometimes it's hard to tell you are firing and where you are aiming, but the hit detections is pretty generous. Graphics and effects look really nice. Decent amount of content, 2 worlds with 5 tracks each.

Lots of fun, very much worth the low price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979579510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1475562238}
review:
Fun Game.

Visuals are great.

Tracks are fun to ride.

Shooting is fun but could use a bit of work. It seems the projectiles do not inherit player velocity, which makes all the shots seem to be fired way behind they are actually being shot. Makes the visuals look weird and it seems harder to hit enemies. There also is no usable gun sights. 

7/10 as is, but with some tweaks it could be even better. In its current state the game is totally worth it.
